intro: Bisnicholsonia, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate and have a distinctive waxy coating, while its flowers are small and clustered. Bisnicholsonia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
